title: Services & Data
description: Manage Firestore, Auth, and other services

cards.description: Deploys only Firestore security rules without affecting other services.
cards.whenToUse: When you've updated security rules and need to push them quickly.
scenarios: Security update: Deploying new access control rules
Rule fix: Quickly pushing a security rule hotfix
Permissions change: Updating who can read/write data

cards.description: Deploys Firestore composite indexes defined in firestore.indexes.json.
cards.whenToUse: When you've added new queries that require composite indexes.
scenarios: Query optimization: Adding indexes for complex queries
Performance fix: Deploying indexes to fix slow queries
New feature: Adding indexes for new query patterns

cards.task: Export Firestore data to a Cloud Storage bucket
cards.description: Exports all Firestore data to Google Cloud Storage for backup or migration.
cards.whenToUse: When creating backups or preparing for data migration.
scenarios: Backup: Creating a full database backup before major changes
Migration: Exporting data to move to another project
Compliance: Archiving data for regulatory requirements

cards.task: Import Firestore data from a Cloud Storage bucket
cards.description: Imports previously exported Firestore data from Cloud Storage.
cards.whenToUse: When restoring from backup or migrating data to a new project.
scenarios: Disaster recovery: Restoring data after accidental deletion
Migration: Importing data into a new project
Environment setup: Populating staging with production data

cards.description: Displays recent logs from your deployed Cloud Functions.
cards.whenToUse: When debugging issues with your Cloud Functions in production.
scenarios: Debugging: Viewing console.log output from functions
Error tracking: Finding error messages from failed executions
Monitoring: Checking function behavior after deployment

cards.description: Removes a specific Cloud Function from your project.
cards.whenToUse: When a function is no longer needed and you want to clean up.
scenarios: Cleanup: Removing deprecated or unused functions
Cost reduction: Deleting functions to reduce billing
Refactoring: Removing functions replaced by new implementations

cards.task: Open the Firebase console in browser
cards.description: Opens the Firebase console for your current project in a web browser.
cards.whenToUse: When you need quick access to the Firebase web console.
scenarios: Quick access: Opening the console without finding the URL
Visual inspection: Checking data in the Firestore viewer
Settings: Accessing project settings not available in CLI

cards.description: Deploys Cloud Storage security rules defined in storage.rules.
cards.whenToUse: When you've updated file access permissions in storage.rules.
scenarios: Security update: Deploying new file access rules
Permission fix: Correcting file upload/download permissions
New feature: Adding rules for new storage paths

cards.description: Shows all Cloud Functions currently deployed to your project.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to see what functions are deployed and their triggers.
scenarios: Inventory: Reviewing all deployed functions
Verification: Confirming a function was deployed
Debugging: Checking function triggers and regions
